[HEADING] Ready to Apply?
With a one-of-a-kind curriculum, unparalleled internship experiences, and a supportive campus community, the Johnson School’s full-time two-year residential MBA prepares you for success in your chosen field through:
Jim’s day took us to classes like Supply Chain Analytics and Advanced Japanese—and later, a Sage Social. When he wasn’t in class, he was planning (and DJing) campus events. Now based in Tokyo at Apple Asia, Jim keeps connected to Cornell as part of our global alumni network.
Lucie loves being surrounded by passionate learners, both as a student and as a teaching assistant. Beyond academics, she participates in Diversity Council meetings and several student organizations—and she makes it a point to unwind with Zumba a few nights a week.
Nikolaos starts his day with breakfast and The Wall Street Journal and ends it catching up with friends at a biweekly veterans happy hour on campus. In between, he attends a student investment club meeting and even changed into a suit to give an in-class presentation to industry partners.
The one-year Johnson Cornell Tech MBA program combines the rigors of a Cornell education with rich, real-world experience. Highlights include:
The newest full-time MBA program offered at the Johnson School, the Johnson Cornell Tech Dual-Campus Track provides an opportunity for students to benefit from opportunities in Ithaca and New York City. The 21-month program consists of four semesters and a required summer internship. Students begin as a member of the Johnson School’s Ithaca-based two-year residential MBA program and are in Ithaca for the fall and spring semesters. After a tech-focused summer internship, students transfer to the Cornell Tech campus in New York City and become members of the Johnson Cornell Tech MBA program.
The Johnson School’s residential MBA program ambassadors are ready to chat with you about academics, internships, extracurriculars, life in Ithaca, NY, and more.
CONNECT NOW
Cornell Tech ambassadors are happy to answer your questions about classes, multidisciplinary Studios, industry connections, and the overall experience at both campuses.
CONNECT NOW
It’s hard to say no when there’s pressure to comply. Sunita Sah’s book tells us how.
New research from the Cornell SC Johnson College finds that people who regularly discuss their finances experience less financial anxiety over time.
The Center for Sustainable Global Enterprise celebrates 20 for 20 honoree Esohe Denise Odaro MBA ’09, head of sustainability at PAI Partners.
Before you apply to one of our full-time MBA programs, we encourage you to explore the admissions requirements for your graduate business degree of interest. Our website is full of information about the application process, plus you’re invited to attend an upcoming information session or chat with a student ambassador.
SEE ADMISSIONS REQUIREMENTS
From virtual information sessions to Ask Admissions! chats, you have several ways to find out which Johnson School full-time MBA program is right for you. We invite you to check out our upcoming events.
VIEW UPCOMING EVENTS
You’ve read about the Johnson School’s cutting-edge curriculum, immersive learning experiences, and close-knit community. If either our two-year Ithaca, NY, program or the one-year Johnson Cornell Tech MBA sounds like the right fit for you, we look forward to learning more about you soon!
• Flexible MBA
• Summer internship
• Immersion learning
• Experiential learning options
• STEM designation option
• Based at Cornell Tech campus on Roosevelt Island in Manhattan
• STEM designation
• Multidisciplinary, cross-functional collaboration with Studio projects
• Opportunity to participate with two-year classmates in an intensive
• Immersive experiences in technology and entrepreneurship
• A strong business core covering topics such as strategy, leadership, marketing management, financial accounting, and data analytics
• Valuable industry experience through immersion learning which prepares you for summer internships, a signature experience of the Johnson School’s two-year MBA
• Customizable academics through immersion areas, electives, cocurriculars, and weekend-long intensive classes
• Personalized career coaching, including assistance with internship placements and employment
• Meaningful opportunities to get involved on and off campus through student organizations, leadership programs, and global treks

Ithaca, NY; additional options for courses in New York City
• Duration
Two years; four semesters and a summer internship
• Ideal for
Those looking for an Ivy League MBA to rapidly enhance their career potential
• Delivery
On-campus featuring experiential learning opportunities
• Spend the summer, fall, and spring semesters at our Cornell Tech campus on Roosevelt Island in New York City.
• Engage with students from other areas of study (such as law and engineering) through project-based classes called Studios.
• Customize your curriculum with electives from the MBA program and across all of Cornell Tech.
• Network with influential business leaders and entrepreneurs during the entire program.
• Location
New York City
• Duration
One year; summer, fall, and spring semesters
• Ideal for
Creative career enhancers with a passion for technology

21 months
• Ideal for
Candidates who want a two-year degree at the intersection of business and technology

Innovate in Ithaca: The Two-Year Johnson School MBA

	


With a one-of-a-kind curriculum, unparalleled internship experiences, and a supportive campus community, the Johnson School’s full-time two-year residential MBA prepares you for success in your chosen field through:

A strong business core covering topics such as strategy, leadership, marketing management, financial accounting, and data analytics
Valuable industry experience through immersion learning which prepares you for summer internships, a signature experience of the Johnson School’s two-year MBA
Customizable academics through immersion areas, electives, cocurriculars, and weekend-long intensive classes
Personalized career coaching, including assistance with internship placements and employment
Meaningful opportunities to get involved on and off campus through student organizations, leadership programs, and global treks

Jim’s Day: Logistics, Language & More

	


Jim’s day took us to classes like Supply Chain Analytics and Advanced Japanese—and later, a Sage Social. When he wasn’t in class, he was planning (and DJing) campus events. Now based in Tokyo at Apple Asia, Jim keeps connected to Cornell as part of our global alumni network.



Meet Jim









	
	Lucie’s Day: From Academics to Zumba

	


Lucie loves being surrounded by passionate learners, both as a student and as a teaching assistant. Beyond academics, she participates in Diversity Council meetings and several student organizations—and she makes it a point to unwind with Zumba a few nights a week.



Hear from Lucie









	
	Nikolaos’ Day: Invested in Experiential Learning

	


Nikolaos starts his day with breakfast and The Wall Street Journal and ends it catching up with friends at a biweekly veterans happy hour on campus. In between, he attends a student investment club meeting and even changed into a suit to give an in-class presentation to industry partners.



Meet Nikolaos

High-Tech, High-Touch: The One-Year Johnson Cornell Tech MBA

	


The one-year Johnson Cornell Tech MBA program combines the rigors of a Cornell education with rich, real-world experience. Highlights include:

Spend the summer, fall, and spring semesters at our Cornell Tech campus on Roosevelt Island in New York City.
Engage with students from other areas of study (such as law and engineering) through project-based classes called Studios.
Customize your curriculum with electives from the MBA program and across all of Cornell Tech.
Network with influential business leaders and entrepreneurs during the entire program.

Combining the Best of Both Worlds: The Johnson Cornell Tech Dual-Campus Track

	


The newest full-time MBA program offered at the Johnson School, the Johnson Cornell Tech Dual-Campus Track provides an opportunity for students to benefit from opportunities in Ithaca and New York City. The 21-month program consists of four semesters and a required summer internship. Students begin as a member of the Johnson School’s Ithaca-based two-year residential MBA program and are in Ithaca for the fall and spring semesters. After a tech-focused summer internship, students transfer to the Cornell Tech campus in New York City and become members of the Johnson Cornell Tech MBA program.

With a one-of-a-kind curriculum, unparalleled internship experiences, and a supportive campus community, the Johnson School’s full-time two-year residential MBA prepares you for success in your chosen field through:

A strong business core covering topics such as strategy, leadership, marketing management, financial accounting, and data analytics
Valuable industry experience through immersion learning which prepares you for summer internships, a signature experience of the Johnson School’s two-year MBA
Customizable academics through immersion areas, electives, cocurriculars, and weekend-long intensive classes
Personalized career coaching, including assistance with internship placements and employment
Meaningful opportunities to get involved on and off campus through student organizations, leadership programs, and global treks

Jim’s Day: Logistics, Language & More
Jim’s Day: Logistics, Language & More

	


Jim’s day took us to classes like Supply Chain Analytics and Advanced Japanese—and later, a Sage Social. When he wasn’t in class, he was planning (and DJing) campus events. Now based in Tokyo at Apple Asia, Jim keeps connected to Cornell as part of our global alumni network.



Meet Jim









	
	Lucie’s Day: From Academics to Zumba

	


Lucie loves being surrounded by passionate learners, both as a student and as a teaching assistant. Beyond academics, she participates in Diversity Council meetings and several student organizations—and she makes it a point to unwind with Zumba a few nights a week.



Hear from Lucie

Nikolaos starts his day with breakfast and The Wall Street Journal and ends it catching up with friends at a biweekly veterans happy hour on campus. In between, he attends a student investment club meeting and even changed into a suit to give an in-class presentation to industry partners.

High-Tech, High-Touch: The One-Year Johnson Cornell Tech MBA
High-Tech, High-Touch: The One-Year Johnson Cornell Tech MBA

	


The one-year Johnson Cornell Tech MBA program combines the rigors of a Cornell education with rich, real-world experience. Highlights include:

Spend the summer, fall, and spring semesters at our Cornell Tech campus on Roosevelt Island in New York City.
Engage with students from other areas of study (such as law and engineering) through project-based classes called Studios.
Customize your curriculum with electives from the MBA program and across all of Cornell Tech.
Network with influential business leaders and entrepreneurs during the entire program.

Combining the Best of Both Worlds: The Johnson Cornell Tech Dual-Campus Track
Combining the Best of Both Worlds: The Johnson Cornell Tech Dual-Campus Track

	


The newest full-time MBA program offered at the Johnson School, the Johnson Cornell Tech Dual-Campus Track provides an opportunity for students to benefit from opportunities in Ithaca and New York City. The 21-month program consists of four semesters and a required summer internship. Students begin as a member of the Johnson School’s Ithaca-based two-year residential MBA program and are in Ithaca for the fall and spring semesters. After a tech-focused summer internship, students transfer to the Cornell Tech campus in New York City and become members of the Johnson Cornell Tech MBA program.

[HEADING] Our Campus and Community
[HEADING] Our Expertise
[HEADING] Next Steps: Where Will Johnson Take You?
In today’s fiercely competitive employment landscape, you need to stand out from other applicants. This is true whether you’re just starting your career, going for a promotion, transitioning into a new field, or finding yourself back in the job market.
Earning a PhD or master’s degree in management is undoubtedly a wise investment in your future, but how do you decide which graduate program is right for you? We encourage you to research our suite of offerings, which includes everything from comparing our EMBA and MBA programs to learning more about our short-term Master of Professional Studies and research-rich PhD program.
Prepare to succeed in an ever-changing global marketplace with a Master of Business Administration from the Johnson School. We offer three innovative, experience-rich options: a two-year residential MBA program based in Ithaca, NY, a one-year Johnson Cornell Tech MBA based in New York City, and a Johnson Cornell Tech 1+1 program that combines elements of our Ithaca and New York City-based programs. In all our full-time MBA programs, you’ll have access to world-class facilities, immersive learning experiences, and renowned scholars and practitioners.

Ithaca, NY, and New York City
If you’re looking for a master’s degree in management that aligns with your career goals and your busy schedule, look no further than an executive MBA. Designed for working professionals, the Johnson School’s innovative EMBA programs allow you to earn a graduate degree without putting your career on hold. In fact, you’ll see your investment in yourself pay off in real time as you apply what you learn as you learn.

The Johnson School offers several specialized management graduate programs that can expand, advance, and enrich your career, including STEM-designated and accounting-focused master’s degrees.
Online with two weeklong residencies
Part-time, STEM-designated
Full-time residential and STEM-designated
Our fully funded, completely residential PhD in management is designed for ambitious students and business professionals interested in pursuing a career in university teaching and research. Based at the Johnson School in Ithaca, NY, this doctoral program combines Ivy League rigor and real-world relevance to prepare you for a successful career in academia or consulting.
A solid business acumen is helpful—if not essential—to executive-level roles in any industry. Earning an MBA in tandem with another graduate degree makes for a powerful combination. Offered in conjunction with other prestigious schools at Cornell, these three combinations have a solid record of success for our alumni:
With hundreds of academic disciplines across Cornell University, additional dual-degree options abound. We also offer a unique fifth-year MBA program that allows exceptional Cornell undergraduates to complement their major area of study with a master’s degree.
The world is changing rapidly. No matter where you are in your career, we’ll help you keep up—and prepare for what’s next. Among our dozens of online and in-person executive education programs, you’ll find courses in fintech, servant leadership, persuasive communication, data privacy strategy, product marketing, and leading remote teams. We also offer customizable training and professional development programs for teams and organizations.
When you choose the Johnson School, you join a community of ambitious learners, thinkers, and doers. Our management master’s degrees and other graduate business programs offer an innovative, immersive curriculum full of unique learning experiences. And our academic programs are designed with input from trusted industry partners and our expansive alumni network.
While our management programs vary in length and format, they all include a residential component. Whether you’re in Ithaca, NY, for a few weeks or a few years, you’ll experience academic life on one of the most iconic college campuses in the United States. Our learning spaces include the Gothic-style Sage Hall and the sleek and modern Breazzano Family Center for Business Education.
With hundreds of accomplished faculty members and more than 15,000 alumni making their mark across the globe, our Cornellians are innovating and leading the way in nearly every sector. The Cornell SC Johnson College of Business is especially known for its deep industry expertise in consulting, technology, entrepreneurship, and investment banking.
Ready to take your career to the next level with one of the Johnson School’s management graduate programs? We encourage you to start your application!
• MBA + Juris Doctor (JD)
• MBA + Master of Industrial and Labor Relations (MILA)
• MBA + Master of Public Administration (MPA)

Dual-Degree Programs
A solid business acumen is helpful—if not essential—to executive-level roles in any industry. Earning an MBA in tandem with another graduate degree makes for a powerful combination. Offered in conjunction with other prestigious schools at Cornell, these three combinations have a solid record of success for our alumni:

MBA + Juris Doctor (JD)
MBA + Master of Industrial and Labor Relations (MILA)
MBA + Master of Public Administration (MPA)

With hundreds of academic disciplines across Cornell University, additional dual-degree options abound. We also offer a unique fifth-year MBA program that allows exceptional Cornell undergraduates to complement their major area of study with a master’s degree.

Finding the Right Management Graduate Degree Program for You
Finding the Right Management Graduate Degree Program for You

	


In today’s fiercely competitive employment landscape, you need to stand out from other applicants. This is true whether you’re just starting your career, going for a promotion, transitioning into a new field, or finding yourself back in the job market.
Earning a PhD or master’s degree in management is undoubtedly a wise investment in your future, but how do you decide which graduate program is right for you? We encourage you to research our suite of offerings, which includes everything from comparing our EMBA and MBA programs to learning more about our short-term Master of Professional Studies and research-rich PhD program.

Full-Time MBA Programs
Full-Time MBA Programs

	


Prepare to succeed in an ever-changing global marketplace with a Master of Business Administration from the Johnson School. We offer three innovative, experience-rich options: a two-year residential MBA program based in Ithaca, NY, a one-year Johnson Cornell Tech MBA based in New York City, and a Johnson Cornell Tech 1+1 program that combines elements of our Ithaca and New York City-based programs. In all our full-time MBA programs, you’ll have access to world-class facilities, immersive learning experiences, and renowned scholars and practitioners.

Whether you’re in Ithaca, NY, for a few weeks or a few years, you’ll experience academic life on one of the most iconic college campuses in the United States. Our learning spaces include the Gothic-style Sage Hall and the sleek and modern Breazzano Family Center for Business Education.

Program Location

Ithaca, NY (with course options available in New York City)
Program Format

Full-time residential
Program Length
The Johnson School’s two-year MBA curriculum provides a comprehensive foundation in key business fundamentals while offering the flexibility to customize your studies. You’ll get to choose electives, minors, immersion areas, and other learning experiences that align with your career goals.
Opportunities to put business concepts into practice abound at the Johnson School, whether collaborating with classmates on a consulting project, trekking the globe on a faculty-led study trip, or embarking on a summer internship with a dream organization.
A residential MBA program is more than academics. Johnson School students love being part of the greater Cornell community—so much so that the Samuel Curtis Johnson Graduate School of Management was rated No. 1 for Best Campus Environment in The Princeton Review’s 2023 B-School rankings.
Technology touches nearly every business role and function today, and top full-time MBA programs are already built with that reality in mind.
An official STEM designation recognizes the real-world relevance of our MBA’s management science path: Its curriculum emphasizes data analytics, technology, and other subjects integral to contemporary business leadership.
For international students considering two-year MBA programs in the United States, it might be helpful to know that the Johnson School’s STEM designation has benefits beyond high-quality, career-focused academics.
Students with the F-1 visa who are enrolled in a STEM-designated program become eligible for a STEM OPT (optional practical training) extension, allowing them to work in the US in an approved STEM field for up to 36 months. This two-year extension:
One of the most effective ways to help determine the best full-time MBA program for you is to speak with current students about their experiences.
We’d love to link you up with a current Johnson School MBA student—perhaps someone with similar career interests or from your home state or country—so that you can chat about academics, extracurriculars, life in Ithaca, and other relevant topics.
CONNECT WITH AN AMBASSADOR
Our core curriculum, designed with input from alumni and industry partners, provides a comprehensive foundation in key business fundamentals. Covering topics such as strategy, leadership, marketing management, financial accounting, and data analytics, the Johnson School’s core sets you up for success for your immersive courses, internship, and, ultimately, your career.

Customized Immersion
Summer internships are a signature experience of the Johnson School’s two-year MBA program. Our Career Management Center provides personalized coaching to help you develop into a strong candidate for internship placement and employment.
During your internship, you’ll gain valuable on-the-job experience in your desired field and make professional connections that will last long after your placement ends. Johnson School students intern with organizations such as Amazon, EY, Microsoft, pwc, J.P. Morgan, and Johnson & Johnson.
Recruiters for top companies and organizations repeatedly say how our rich, immersive learning experiences, including these coveted internships, set Johnson School MBAs apart from other applicants.
EXPLORE Career Management
Within the college of business, you’ll find more than 100 electives to choose from. You’ll also have access to courses across Cornell University, where you can learn from world-renowned educators in other disciplines.
Gain leadership and cross-cultural experience through global treks, leadership expeditions, and other professional development programs. Plus, many campus clubs and organizations offer ways to gain skills and experience—and make lasting friendships.
As a student in the Johnson School’s two-year full-time MBA program, you’ll have the option to enroll in weekend-long courses at Cornell Tech in New York City. Offerings will vary by semester but often include classes where business and technology intersect.
Explore the large-scale technical advances in the financial services industry.
Learn about audience engagement and customer retention in the digital world.
Meet the founders of the 29 startups selected to participate in this year’s Johnson Summer Startup Accelerator.
New SC Johnson College research shows that news articles and reviews play a significant role in promoting luxury watch brands.
A new study from SC Johnson College explores the concept of “cognitive endurance,” defined as the ability to sustain performance in cognitive tasks over time.
From class visits to campus socials, there are many ways to find out if the Johnson School is the best two-year MBA program for you. We hope you’ll join us for one of our many virtual or in-person admissions events.

Connect with a Johnson Student Ambassador

Explore Our Campus

More About MBA Costs
Johnson School MBA graduates are highly coveted in the job market. Recruiters seek Johnson School MBAs because they find them exceptionally well-prepared and strong team players who begin making meaningful contributions to employers on day one. See our most recent employment data for more information.
Our immersions are a combination of specialized coursework and performance learning activities aimed at providing you with exceptional preparation for your summer internship. Building on the general management foundation of functional skills you gain through your core courses, these immersions give you specialized knowledge in a particular field. Companies consistently tell us that our interns are better able to make an immediate contribution than students from peer institutions.
No. Our program is structured to deliver content and hone skills in a sequence. Students get most of their functional knowledge foundation and participate in an integrative case competition in the first fall semester then take an immersion in the spring that provides exceptional preparation for the summer internship.
Yes. Our Career Management Center is regarded as one of the best in the world. They maintain and continue to grow the list of companies that recruit at the Johnson School. Our goal is not only to help you get an internship and then a job, but to ensure that you leave with the skills to successfully search for positions throughout your career. At the Johnson School, you’ll frequently find students critiquing each other’s resumes, putting each other through mock interviews, and offering encouragement and support. Our alumni are also involved in helping students prepare for interviews.
The short answer is: We don’t know and won’t until you apply. If you look at the profile of our admitted students, read our student blogs, and see yourself at the Johnson School, then please apply!
Our goal is to select individuals who will not only succeed in our MBA program, but make a real and lasting impact on their organizations and the world around them. Our goal is to select individuals who will succeed in our MBA program and make a real and lasting difference in their organizations and the world around them. We recruit students with a broad range of backgrounds and experiences such that everyone contributes to and benefits from a culture in which learning is an intensely shared process. So while a strong undergraduate record, high scores on the GMAT, and success in jobs are all important considerations, we also look for demonstrations of leadership, the ability to work with others, and other traits and experiences that contribute to individual success and collaborative learning and work.
A robust pathway to admittance into the Cornell MBA is through the Cornell MBA Future Leaders Program – a deferred admissions program for those not yet at the level of work experience typically needed to qualify, but who know that an MBA is in their near future plans.
You’ve read about our innovative curriculum, immersive learning experiences, and tight-knit community. If the two-year Johnson School MBA program sounds like the right fit, we can’t wait to learn more about you!

Benefits of STEM Designation for International Students
For international students considering two-year MBA programs in the United States, it might be helpful to know that the Johnson School’s STEM designation has benefits beyond high-quality, career-focused academics.
Students with the F-1 visa who are enrolled in a STEM-designated program become eligible for a STEM OPT (optional practical training) extension, allowing them to work in the US in an approved STEM field for up to 36 months. This two-year extension:

Increases hireability
Extends professional training opportunities
Provides work authorization for summer internships
Offers additional chances in the annual lottery for limited US H-1B skilled work visas

How do Johnson School MBAs fare in the job market?
					



 Johnson School MBA graduates are highly coveted in the job market. Recruiters seek Johnson School MBAs because they find them exceptionally well-prepared and strong team players who begin making meaningful contributions to employers on day one. See our most recent employment data for more information.






						Why do you offer immersions in the first year instead of the second?
					



Our immersions are a combination of specialized coursework and performance learning activities aimed at providing you with exceptional preparation for your summer internship. Building on the general management foundation of functional skills you gain through your core courses, these immersions give you specialized knowledge in a particular field. Companies consistently tell us that our interns are better able to make an immediate contribution than students from peer institutions.






						Can I start my MBA in the spring semester?
					



No. Our program is structured to deliver content and hone skills in a sequence. Students get most of their functional knowledge foundation and participate in an integrative case competition in the first fall semester then take an immersion in the spring that provides exceptional preparation for the summer internship.






						Will you help me find an internship?
					



Yes. Our Career Management Center is regarded as one of the best in the world. They maintain and continue to grow the list of companies that recruit at the Johnson School. Our goal is not only to help you get an internship and then a job, but to ensure that you leave with the skills to successfully search for positions throughout your career. At the Johnson School, you’ll frequently find students critiquing each other’s resumes, putting each other through mock interviews, and offering encouragement and support. Our alumni are also involved in helping students prepare for interviews.






						What are my chances of gaining admission into the Johnson School two-year MBA program?
					



The short answer is: We don’t know and won’t until you apply. If you look at the profile of our admitted students, read our student blogs, and see yourself at the Johnson School, then please apply!
Our goal is to select individuals who will not only succeed in our MBA program, but make a real and lasting impact on their organizations and the world around them. Our goal is to select individuals who will succeed in our MBA program and make a real and lasting difference in their organizations and the world around them. We recruit students with a broad range of backgrounds and experiences such that everyone contributes to and benefits from a culture in which learning is an intensely shared process. So while a strong undergraduate record, high scores on the GMAT, and success in jobs are all important considerations, we also look for demonstrations of leadership, the ability to work with others, and other traits and experiences that contribute to individual success and collaborative learning and work.






						I don’t have any full-time work experience. Can I still apply?
					



A robust pathway to admittance into the Cornell MBA is through the Cornell MBA Future Leaders Program – a deferred admissions program for those not yet at the level of work experience typically needed to qualify, but who know that an MBA is in their near future plans.

Innovative Academics

	


The Johnson School’s two-year MBA curriculum provides a comprehensive foundation in key business fundamentals while offering the flexibility to customize your studies. You’ll get to choose electives, minors, immersion areas, and other learning experiences that align with your career goals.










	
	Immersive Experiences

	


Opportunities to put business concepts into practice abound at the Johnson School, whether collaborating with classmates on a consulting project, trekking the globe on a faculty-led study trip, or embarking on a summer internship with a dream organization.










	
	Inviting Community 

	


A residential MBA program is more than academics. Johnson School students love being part of the greater Cornell community—so much so that the Samuel Curtis Johnson Graduate School of Management was rated No. 1 for Best Campus Environment in The Princeton Review’s 2023 B-School rankings.

Our STEM Designation: The Intersection of Business and Tech
Technology touches nearly every business role and function today, and top full-time MBA programs are already built with that reality in mind.
An official STEM designation recognizes the real-world relevance of our MBA’s management science path: Its curriculum emphasizes data analytics, technology, and other subjects integral to contemporary business leadership.
[CARD]
Benefits of STEM Designation for International Students
For international students considering two-year MBA programs in the United States, it might be helpful to know that the Johnson School’s STEM designation has benefits beyond high-quality, career-focused academics.
Students with the F-1 visa who are enrolled in a STEM-designated program become eligible for a STEM OPT (optional practical training) extension, allowing them to work in the US in an approved STEM field for up to 36 months. This two-year extension:

Increases hireability
Extends professional training opportunities
Provides work authorization for summer internships
Offers additional chances in the annual lottery for limited US H-1B skilled work visas
[CARD]
Peer to Peer: Connect with an MBA Student Ambassador
One of the most effective ways to help determine the best full-time MBA program for you is to speak with current students about their experiences.
We’d love to link you up with a current Johnson School MBA student—perhaps someone with similar career interests or from your home state or country—so that you can chat about academics, extracurriculars, life in Ithaca, and other relevant topics.
CONNECT WITH AN AMBASSADOR
[CARD]
Innovative Academics: A Look at Our Two-Year MBA Curriculum
Our core curriculum, designed with input from alumni and industry partners, provides a comprehensive foundation in key business fundamentals. Covering topics such as strategy, leadership, marketing management, financial accounting, and data analytics, the Johnson School’s core sets you up for success for your immersive courses, internship, and, ultimately, your career.

During your internship, you’ll gain valuable on-the-job experience in your desired field and make professional connections that will last long after your placement ends. Johnson School students intern with organizations such as Amazon, EY, Microsoft, pwc, J.P. Morgan, and Johnson & Johnson.
Recruiters for top companies and organizations repeatedly say how our rich, immersive learning experiences, including these coveted internships, set Johnson School MBAs apart from other applicants.

How do Johnson School MBAs fare in the job market?
How do Johnson School MBAs fare in the job market?
					



 Johnson School MBA graduates are highly coveted in the job market. Recruiters seek Johnson School MBAs because they find them exceptionally well-prepared and strong team players who begin making meaningful contributions to employers on day one. See our most recent employment data for more information.






						Why do you offer immersions in the first year instead of the second?
					



Our immersions are a combination of specialized coursework and performance learning activities aimed at providing you with exceptional preparation for your summer internship. Building on the general management foundation of functional skills you gain through your core courses, these immersions give you specialized knowledge in a particular field. Companies consistently tell us that our interns are better able to make an immediate contribution than students from peer institutions.






						Can I start my MBA in the spring semester?
					



No. Our program is structured to deliver content and hone skills in a sequence. Students get most of their functional knowledge foundation and participate in an integrative case competition in the first fall semester then take an immersion in the spring that provides exceptional preparation for the summer internship.






						Will you help me find an internship?
					



Yes. Our Career Management Center is regarded as one of the best in the world. They maintain and continue to grow the list of companies that recruit at the Johnson School. Our goal is not only to help you get an internship and then a job, but to ensure that you leave with the skills to successfully search for positions throughout your career. At the Johnson School, you’ll frequently find students critiquing each other’s resumes, putting each other through mock interviews, and offering encouragement and support. Our alumni are also involved in helping students prepare for interviews.






						What are my chances of gaining admission into the Johnson School two-year MBA program?
					



The short answer is: We don’t know and won’t until you apply. If you look at the profile of our admitted students, read our student blogs, and see yourself at the Johnson School, then please apply!
Our goal is to select individuals who will not only succeed in our MBA program, but make a real and lasting impact on their organizations and the world around them. Our goal is to select individuals who will succeed in our MBA program and make a real and lasting difference in their organizations and the world around them. We recruit students with a broad range of backgrounds and experiences such that everyone contributes to and benefits from a culture in which learning is an intensely shared process. So while a strong undergraduate record, high scores on the GMAT, and success in jobs are all important considerations, we also look for demonstrations of leadership, the ability to work with others, and other traits and experiences that contribute to individual success and collaborative learning and work.






						I don’t have any full-time work experience. Can I still apply?
					



A robust pathway to admittance into the Cornell MBA is through the Cornell MBA Future Leaders Program – a deferred admissions program for those not yet at the level of work experience typically needed to qualify, but who know that an MBA is in their near future plans.
[CARD]

[HEADING] Ready to Take the Next Step? Start Your Application Today
The Johnson School offers two full-time MBA programs: the two-year residential program in Ithaca, NY, and the one-year Johnson Cornell Tech MBA based in New York City. You may only apply to one, so before you begin the application process, we encourage you to research your options and determine which one is the best fit for your background and career goals.
Beyond exploring our program websites, you can also attend an admissions event, take an in-person campus tour, or connect directly with an admissions counselor.
As you prepare to apply to the two-year program, we encourage you to review our Cornell MBA admissions guide, which includes everything from eligibility requirements to the individual components you’ll need to submit with your application.
If you’re a tech-savvy professional with an entrepreneurial spirit, the one-year tech MBA might be the right choice for you—especially if you’re already working full-time. Admission to this MBA program is handled directly through Cornell Tech.
Find information about the Johnson Cornell Tech MBA application process and get details about upcoming admissions events at the Cornell Tech website or by emailing admissions@tech.cornell.edu.
No matter where you are, you can connect with the Cornell admissions team as well as MBA student ambassadors. We host virtual admissions events throughout the year, including Ask Admissions online chats and webinars hosted by partner organizations.
UPCOMING VIRTUAL EVENTS
See where you’ll grow professionally and personally. Explore our campuses from wherever you are. Take a look inside Sage Hall, the Breazzano Family Center for Business Education, and other learning spaces at the Johnson School in Ithaca, NY. Or, explore the high-tech environment at Cornell Tech on New York City’s Roosevelt Island.
VIEW OUR CAMPUS
The Johnson School hosts a variety of admissions events on campus in Ithaca, NY. Prospective students are welcome at networking and social events throughout the year. Explore the list of upcoming opportunities!
Those interested in the Johnson Cornell Tech MBA can attend admissions events at Cornell Tech in New York City.
ON-CAMPUS EVENTS
Our Two-Year MBA is a residential program, and that means you’ll get to live and learn on Cornell University’s beautiful, historic campus in Ithaca, NY. Experience life at the Johnson School through an in-person campus visit!
In addition to arranging a walking tour, you might also be able to sit in on an engaging class, connect with students at a Sage Social, or participate in a Coffee & Convos event.
Do you want more details about the Johnson School’s full-time MBA programs before applying? Submit a brief request for information to start a conversation with our admissions team. After you submit the form, we’ll contact you soon.
Choosing to pursue an MBA is a big decision and a major investment in yourself and your future. Learn more about the estimated cost of attendance, including tuition, books, supplies, and living expenses.
Plus, find information about payment options and financial aid for MBA students, including student loans, merit scholarships, and fellowships. (About 35 percent of Johnson School students receive scholarship assistance.)
If you’ve done the research and feel confident that our innovative curriculum, immersive learning experiences, and tight-knit community are right for you, we encourage you to apply to the Two-Year MBA or the Johnson Cornell Tech MBA. We can’t wait to learn more about you and your goals.
The Two-Year MBA application process begins with registering for an application account with Cornell Admissions

Finding Your Fit: Choosing the Right Cornell MBA Program
Finding Your Fit: Choosing the Right Cornell MBA Program

	


The Johnson School offers two full-time MBA programs: the two-year residential program in Ithaca, NY, and the one-year Johnson Cornell Tech MBA based in New York City. You may only apply to one, so before you begin the application process, we encourage you to research your options and determine which one is the best fit for your background and career goals.
Beyond exploring our program websites, you can also attend an admissions event, take an in-person campus tour, or connect directly with an admissions counselor.
[CARD]

[CARD]

Applying to the Johnson Cornell Tech MBA
If you’re a tech-savvy professional with an entrepreneurial spirit, the one-year tech MBA might be the right choice for you—especially if you’re already working full-time. Admission to this MBA program is handled directly through Cornell Tech.
Find information about the Johnson Cornell Tech MBA application process and get details about upcoming admissions events at the Cornell Tech website or by emailing admissions@tech.cornell.edu.

[HEADING] Next Steps: Applying to a Cornell MBA Dual-Degree Program
Sometimes referred to as double-degree master’s programs, these graduate-level offerings can expand your career potential by not only giving you a second academic credential, but also broadening your skills and knowledge. The Cornell SC Johnson College of Business offers several flexible dual degrees in partnership with other prestigious schools at Cornell University.
Prepare for a career at the intersection of law and business.
Successful business executives have a firm understanding of intellectual property, keen knowledge of technology law, and familiarity with financial regulation. Likewise, corporate legal counsel benefits from a solid grasp of business functions.
The Cornell Law School is one of the oldest, most notable law schools in the nation—and it’s a powerhouse in business law. Whether you’re an aspiring attorney interested in mergers and acquisitions or an entrepreneur looking to boost legal knowledge, the MBA-plus-JD program gives you an unprecedented opportunity to study with renowned experts at two top-tier schools.
Transform the future of work with expertise in both HR and business strategy.
Boost your career potential with two business-related graduate degrees from two widely respected schools: Johnson and Cornell University School of Industrial and Labor Relations.
With its focus on leadership and business strategy, this dual-degree graduate program is ideal for human resource management professionals who want to build more comprehensive expertise in executive business leadership. If you’re coming from a business background, the labor relations knowledge you’ll develop in the MILR-plus- MBA program is the perfect preparation for a career in management consulting.
Solve evolving business and societal challenges.
Profit isn’t the only measure of success. Become a business-savvy changemaker by combining your Johnson School MBA with a Master of Public Administration from the Cornell Jeb E. Brooks School of Public Policy.
This dual-degree program blends business and problem-solving skills with knowledge of complex societal issues, preparing our alumni to make an impact in healthcare, financial services, manufacturing, government, nonprofit leadership, public agency administration, and other fields. Full of experiential learning opportunities—including a summer internship with each school—you’ll gain experience and make a difference long before you graduate.
One additional year. Countless opportunities.
Our special fifth-year MBA program allows exceptional Cornell undergraduates to complement their major area of study with a master’s degree. Choose from hundreds of academic disciplines across the university—from agriculture and engineering to biology and mathematics.
Cornell students interested in this dual-degree master’s program will typically apply to the Johnson School MBA during the fall semester of their junior year.
The Johnson School is home to ambitious learners, brilliant faculty members, and a caring staff. Our programs are fueled by an innovative curriculum, immersive experiences, and expert input from industry partners. But with a double-degree master’s program, the Johnson School will be just one part of your academic journey; you’ll also experience everything your other school offers!
Experience academic life on one of the nation’s most iconic college campuses. Within the Johnson School, you’ll spend time in learning spaces like the Gothic-style Sage Hall and the sleek and modern Breazzano Family Center for Business Education. Located in the scenic Finger Lakes region of New York, you’ll also have much to explore in and around Ithaca.
With hundreds of faculty members spanning business disciplines and functions, our collective knowledge and experience reach far and wide. The Johnson School is especially known for its deep industry expertise in consulting, entrepreneurship, investment banking, and technology.
Ready to give yourself a professional edge by pursuing a dual graduate degree from Cornell? We encourage you to start the application process soon. Remember: double-degree master’s candidates should apply to both relevant schools.
The first step is to register or log in to the Cornell Graduate Admissions website.

What Is a Dual-Degree MBA?
Sometimes referred to as double-degree master’s programs, these graduate-level offerings can expand your career potential by not only giving you a second academic credential, but also broadening your skills and knowledge. The Cornell SC Johnson College of Business offers several flexible dual degrees in partnership with other prestigious schools at Cornell University.
[CARD]
Juris Doctor (JD) plus MBA
Prepare for a career at the intersection of law and business.
Successful business executives have a firm understanding of intellectual property, keen knowledge of technology law, and familiarity with financial regulation. Likewise, corporate legal counsel benefits from a solid grasp of business functions.
The Cornell Law School is one of the oldest, most notable law schools in the nation—and it’s a powerhouse in business law. Whether you’re an aspiring attorney interested in mergers and acquisitions or an entrepreneur looking to boost legal knowledge, the MBA-plus-JD program gives you an unprecedented opportunity to study with renowned experts at two top-tier schools.


Explore JD/MBA
[CARD]
Juris Doctor (JD) plus MBA
Prepare for a career at the intersection of law and business.
Successful business executives have a firm understanding of intellectual property, keen knowledge of technology law, and familiarity with financial regulation. Likewise, corporate legal counsel benefits from a solid grasp of business functions.
The Cornell Law School is one of the oldest, most notable law schools in the nation—and it’s a powerhouse in business law. Whether you’re an aspiring attorney interested in mergers and acquisitions or an entrepreneur looking to boost legal knowledge, the MBA-plus-JD program gives you an unprecedented opportunity to study with renowned experts at two top-tier schools.
[CARD]
Master of Industrial and Labor Relations (MILR) plus MBA
Transform the future of work with expertise in both HR and business strategy.
Boost your career potential with two business-related graduate degrees from two widely respected schools: Johnson and Cornell University School of Industrial and Labor Relations.
With its focus on leadership and business strategy, this dual-degree graduate program is ideal for human resource management professionals who want to build more comprehensive expertise in executive business leadership. If you’re coming from a business background, the labor relations knowledge you’ll develop in the MILR-plus- MBA program is the perfect preparation for a career in management consulting.


View MILR/MBA
[CARD]
Master of Industrial and Labor Relations (MILR) plus MBA
Transform the future of work with expertise in both HR and business strategy.
Boost your career potential with two business-related graduate degrees from two widely respected schools: Johnson and Cornell University School of Industrial and Labor Relations.
With its focus on leadership and business strategy, this dual-degree graduate program is ideal for human resource management professionals who want to build more comprehensive expertise in executive business leadership. If you’re coming from a business background, the labor relations knowledge you’ll develop in the MILR-plus- MBA program is the perfect preparation for a career in management consulting.
[CARD]
Master of Public Administration (MPA) plus MBA
Solve evolving business and societal challenges.
Profit isn’t the only measure of success. Become a business-savvy changemaker by combining your Johnson School MBA with a Master of Public Administration from the Cornell Jeb E. Brooks School of Public Policy.
This dual-degree program blends business and problem-solving skills with knowledge of complex societal issues, preparing our alumni to make an impact in healthcare, financial services, manufacturing, government, nonprofit leadership, public agency administration, and other fields. Full of experiential learning opportunities—including a summer internship with each school—you’ll gain experience and make a difference long before you graduate.

Cornell students interested in this dual-degree master’s program will typically apply to the Johnson School MBA during the fall semester of their junior year.

[HEADING] The One-Year Johnson Cornell Tech MBA: Your Questions, Answered
Technology is transforming every aspect of business. Digital expertise is no longer limited to the IT department. Every leader at every level of an organization benefits from tech proficiency—and a startup mindset.
The STEM-designated Johnson Cornell Tech MBA, with Cornell ranked third for AI research by CSRankings, was designed with technically inclined, AI-focused professionals in mind. The full-time one year program will enable you to tackle new professional challenges in an evolving digital landscape.
Request Information
Learn how our Studio environment brings together interdisciplinary teams to engage in AI-centric problem-solving for today’s digital economy.
The Johnson Cornell Tech degree, issued by the Johnson School, is an ideal option for leaders who’ll be working in and around the tech sector. In this full-time, one-year MBA program, you’ll gain foundational business knowledge before immersing in tech coursework and exploring electives related to your areas of interest.
One of the primary distinctions of the full-time Johnson Cornell Tech MBA is the Studio component. This interactive, interdisciplinary experience ensures that business students learn how to effectively collaborate with peers from other Cornell Tech programs ranging from law to engineering.
Another key element of the Tech MBA is the STEM designation, which infuses the curriculum with management science, data analytics, technology, and other disciplines integral to contemporary business leadership and comes with additional benefits for international students.
Located at the innovative Cornell Tech campus on Roosevelt Island in New York City, the immersive, interdisciplinary Johnson Cornell Tech MBA program is designed for those wanting to build in tech with business acumen.
The one-year Tech MBA is structured around three pillars: business core, Studio curriculum, and electives. Here’s a semester-by-semester glance:
Throughout the program you’ll also take electives based on your interest.
Connect with Student Ambassadors
Technological fluency is no longer just a preferred qualification for top leaders; it’s a necessity.
A tech-focused MBA goes beyond standard business fundamentals, giving you specialized skills and knowledge in high-demand areas such as artificial intelligence, data analytics, digital communications, and product management.
Our official STEM designation from the US government recognizes that the program meets specific business and technology curriculum requirements. STEM MBA programs also come with benefits for international students, such as extended visa durations.
Hands-on learning is a hallmark of a technology MBA, and this might be most evident in Studio. During this unparalleled learning experience, students from different graduate programs across Cornell Tech develop a tech product or professional service in response to a real-world issue.
EXPLORE THE JOHNSON CORNELL TECH MBA CURRICULUM
With a razor-sharp focus on high-demand business specialties, MBA intensives give you an edge in today’s digital economy. Designed with collaboration in mind, these innovative programs blend classroom learning with practical experience. Current offerings include:
Explore the large-scale technological advances in the financial services sector.
Discover how to engage audiences and retain customers in a digital-first world.
Learn More About Intensives
Whether you call it a master’s in technology management or a tech MBA, this advanced degree will give you the knowledge and practical skills to advance your career well beyond graduation.
Johnson Cornell Tech MBA graduates move up in their current industry, launch companies of their own, or pivot to new roles in tech. In this intensive, one-year program, you will work on real-world projects on cross-functional teams and master the skill of working with colleagues across multiple disciplines.
They also become part of the ever-growing global Big Red alumni network, which keeps them connected to opportunities across industries and locations.

of Class of 2024 job seekers received offers within 3 months of graduation

founders since Class of 2022
Experience our beautiful, historic campus in Ithaca, NY—and the energy of one the world’s biggest and most diverse cities.
During the Summer semester, students will attend a one-week summer session at Cornell University’s main campus in Ithaca, NY where they will take some of their Cornell SC Johnson College of Business core courses.
Most coursework takes place at Cornell Tech in New York City, where you’ll spend your time immersed in collaborative, project-based learning alongside grad students from other programs.
When you pursue your Johnson Cornell Tech MBA, you’ll become part of a nationally ranked, world-class business school. Here, we don’t just prepare the next generation of leaders and founders; we’re also transforming the way companies use technology to do business for good.
The Johnson Cornell Tech MBA admissions committee considers previous academic success, professional achievements, character, and professional promise.
Successful candidates have a passion for technology, an entrepreneurial spirit, and a collaborative attitude. They are critical thinkers, demonstrated leaders, skilled communicators, and excellent problem solvers.
We welcome candidates from a diversity of backgrounds with digital expertise grounded in full-time professional experiences in or adjacent to the tech industry. While desirable, a background in science, engineering, technology, or coding languages is not required for admission.
What is a tech MBA, and what makes the Johnson School and the Cornell Tech program stand out from the rest? We answer these questions and more:
What Is a Tech MBA, and How Does It Differ from a Traditional MBA?
The Johnson Cornell Tech MBA is designed to educate leaders for the age of AI. We train our graduates to understand the strategic, societal, and ethical dimensions of cutting-edge technologies as well as the technological underpinnings of successful businesses and equip them with an entrepreneurial mindset as well as a toolkit so they can change the world for the better.
For those less technically experienced and looking to pivot into a tech career, we recommend applying to the 1+1 MBA program, which provides business acumen and tech skills.
What Is the Benefit of a Tech MBA?
As the pace of tech innovation continues to impact business, companies seek employees who possess a fundamental understanding of tech issues combined with well-developed critical thinking skills. The best tech MBA programs offer classroom and practical learning experiences and emphasize analytical, creative, and team-building skills and are best positioned to supply companies with such candidates.
Why Is a STEM MBA More Valuable Now than Ever Before?
The greatest change experienced by MBAs entering the workplace in recent years is that technology is the bedrock of any industry today. To be a successful leader requires an integrative understanding of collaborative technology, business, and society, making tech and STEM MBAs essential to firms and markets.
What Makes a Johnson Cornell Tech MBA the Best Among Its Peers?
The main differentiator for the Johnson Cornell Tech MBA is our innovative Studio curriculum, which asks students to find solutions to real-world challenges at the intersection of technology and business while working in cross-program teams that closely simulate the workplace today. Students work with others from various graduate tech degree programs on challenges facing existing companies or set up new ventures in order to solve problems in the market and/or society.
Why Does the Johnson Cornell Tech MBA Have Cross-Functional Teams?
Almost every business challenge in industry requires a multitude of perspectives and skills. The opportunity to work on a cross-functional team gives Johnson Cornell Tech MBA students a chance to hone their skills of incorporating diverse perspectives into a common solution. This is invaluable training for real-world dynamics in any business.
Have a question about the Johnson Cornell Tech MBA that isn’t answered here? Remember: You can always chat with one of our ambassadors, connect with an admissions representative, or participate in an interactive admissions event.

What Is a Tech MBA?
What Is a Tech MBA?
The Johnson Cornell Tech degree, issued by the Johnson School, is an ideal option for leaders who’ll be working in and around the tech sector. In this full-time, one-year MBA program, you’ll gain foundational business knowledge before immersing in tech coursework and exploring electives related to your areas of interest.
One of the primary distinctions of the full-time Johnson Cornell Tech MBA is the Studio component. This interactive, interdisciplinary experience ensures that business students learn how to effectively collaborate with peers from other Cornell Tech programs ranging from law to engineering.
Another key element of the Tech MBA is the STEM designation, which infuses the curriculum with management science, data analytics, technology, and other disciplines integral to contemporary business leadership and comes with additional benefits for international students.

STEM-Designated: An MBA with an AI Focus
STEM-Designated: An MBA with an AI Focus
Technological fluency is no longer just a preferred qualification for top leaders; it’s a necessity.
A tech-focused MBA goes beyond standard business fundamentals, giving you specialized skills and knowledge in high-demand areas such as artificial intelligence, data analytics, digital communications, and product management.
Our official STEM designation from the US government recognizes that the program meets specific business and technology curriculum requirements. STEM MBA programs also come with benefits for international students, such as extended visa durations.
